intro: Tacsonia cumbalensis, commonly known as the Cumbal tacsonia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in cool and temperate climates. Its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, while its flowers display a mix of yellow and white petals. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Tacsonia cumbalensis is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
